answers.answer: I had my son at 35  weeks because of the same thing and he is perfect. He was a little small and needed to learn how to suck, swallow, and breath at the same but he was completely developed, they will be fine, keep her away from Fb for a.while

I wish I could! She is two hours south of me, and I'm tempted to go down there to be with her. Only issue is that I'm 38 weeks myself. I feel awful for not being able to be there! I want to tell people on her thread to shut the hell up.
Is she having a boy or a girl?
Just try to keep her positive, im sure everything will be ok. Tell her she needs to be strong and positive for her baby. Good luck and she is in my prayers.
Just try to keep her positive, im sure everything will be ok. Tell her she needs to be strong and positive for her baby. Good luck and she is in my prayers.

It's not like they're inducing early for no reason at all, preeclampsia and staying in the uterus longer puts both her and baby at risk, so OBVIOUSLY the benefits outweigh the risks, I wouldn't mind letting everyone know that, either.
I know yeah not like she can't be arsed being pregnant anymore and she just wants him out its for a medical reasonFacebook had a lot to answer for, its so vicious.
It's just so uncalled for. She is ignoring those people better than I would have.
It's not like it's her choice, if her doc said that's what's has 2 be then it has 2 be for the good of baby and for good of mama also..she shouldn't listen to ignorant beep beep beep!
This is a question that no one can answer lol.  Some people are just brutal.

i dnt think its being rude i thnk they r just worried in all actuality bby could be on 32weeks gestation and be on ventualtors and nicu for a mnth i thnk they r just worried for her as if i had a frnd being induced that early i would be very concerned as well even tho its for medical reasons maybe they dnt understand but i thnks its natural for anyone to be worried about a bby being born that early so maybe they should knw the whole story behind the reason but i dnt thnk its rude to be worried
They may be worried but they don't know what's best and dont need to make a mother feel even more terrible about a health issue she can't control.  That's rude.

I agree u said she posted there was a problem instead of ridiculing they should be wishing her and the baby luck and prayers...I'm sorry she is having to go through that my cousin had to have her baby at 32 weeks AMD he weighed 1'12" he was tiny but he is a happy healthy 12 year old now and is very smart.

Everything will be fine the hospital are there to make sure of that they no what they are doing her baby will be fine happy and healthy tell her not to stress as baby will be fine it's only a fuw weeks early same women naturally go at 36 weeks so baby will be fine xx
How bout she just delete the status

question: My friend just announced she is having her baby early due to preeclampsia Monday at 34 weeks. People are blowing up her Facebook about how he isn't ready yet, and she isn't due yet with him and blah blah. She is terrified, and these idiots are making it worse. Can people not read before they start gossiping?
title: why are people so rude?
